1.caption: My first view of Rainier
1.text: This was my very first view of the mountain, I came out of the forest and boom!  There it was.... Not bad.  Not bad at all.
1.title: Day 1 - Wonderland Trail

2.caption: I was very grateful there were bridges (sometimes there aren't)
2.text: A typical bridge over one of the many, many, many river crossings.  It's a blessing to have these, you don't always get such an easy method of crossing
2.title: Day 1 - Wonderland Trail

3.caption: Can you imagine living here?
3.text: Wildflowers, a rustic cabin, and a beautiful mountain.  Add a waterfall and this is my sister's dream house.
3.title: Day 1 - Wonderland Trail

4.caption: Terrifying.
4.text: I have a moderate fear of heights, and a solid fear of questionable shaky structures.  So yeah, this one was not my favorite.
4.title: Day 1 - Wonderland Trail

5.caption: The views were spectacular
5.text: I had absolutely perfect weather, I didn't see a single cloud the entire tripe (which is really rare for rainy Washington).  So there are going to be a lot of pretty pictures of Rainier coming up.  You'd better just get use to it now.
5.title: Day 1 - Wonderland Trail

6.caption: Emerald Ridge
6.text: Emerald Ridge.  Beautiful views.  Horrible mosquitoes.
6.title: Day 1 - Wonderland Trail

7.caption: The wildflowers appear
7.text: The first appearance of the wildflowers.  There would be a lot more of these to come...
7.title: Day 1 - Wonderland Trail

8.caption: A lava formation?
8.text: Some sort of a lava formation.  It probably has a technical name... I was happily hiking down the trail when this random woman stopped me and insisted that I go down a side trail to see this.  She thought they were the most amazing things in the world, so I faked some enthusiasm and ran away as quickly as I could.  She was a little scary.  Forget about bears, it's the weird, random people you meet that will scare you the most on the trail
8.title: Day 1 - Wonderland Trail

9.caption: St. Andrews Lake.  Maybe?
9.text: A pretty lake.  It might be St. Andrews Lake.  Even a few days after this trip I couldn't remember the name of this lake, so 7 years later I'm definitely not going to remember.  The weird part is that someone was swimming in that very, um, refreshing looking water.  It's fed by glaciers, those are usually warm and soothing, right?
9.title: Day 1 - Wonderland Trail

10.caption: Damn.  Looking sexy.
10.text: Oh wow, look at how grubby and disgusting I look.  It's amazing how I slipped right back into thru-hiker mode after like 2 days on the trail.  Once a thru hiker, always a thru hiker.
10.title: Day 2 - Wonderland Trail

11.caption: Suspension Bridge #2
11.text: The second suspension bridge.  The Gatorade bottle seems to be enjoying it, I did not.
11.title: Day 2 - Wonderland Trail

12.caption: Carbon Glacier
12.text: My first glacier of the trip.  Carbon Glacier, to be exact.  This is where I decided that glaciers are big.  I mean, I know that's obvious, but there's something about being there that makes you go: 'Whoa, that's a lot of ice.'
12.title: Day 2 - Wonderland Trail

13.caption: Pretty trail
13.text: Just a pretty picture of the trail.  This was one of the best sections of the trail for wildflowers, this meadow was covered in them.  After awhile you're like: 'yeah, yeah, pretty flowers, I get it.' Or maybe that's just me?
13.title: Day 2 - Wonderland Trail

14.caption: The ole tarp tent.  I miss that thing
14.text: My camp on night #2.  Mystic Lakes.  Rainier is a National Park, and so they have a lot of annoying rules, like you have to camp at certain spots, you have to pick your camp sites before the trip, etc.  It's easy to pick spots on a map before a trip, it's another thing to be committed to those spots DURING your trip.  If I had my choice I would not have stayed here.
14.title: Day 2 - Wonderland Trail

15.caption: Winthrop Glacier
15.text: Up close and personal with Winthrop Glacier.  As you're walking by you'll hear a boom and look and see rocks tumbling down the glacier.  Happens all the time.  Glaciers are crazy, I love them so much.
15.title: Day 3 - Wonderland Trail

17.caption: Sunrise!
17.text: Sunrise!  That's the name of this little spot, i wasn't actually there during a sunrise.  Lots of tourists, which is bad, but lots of tourists means lots of potentially yummy food, which is good, so I risked it and headed in.  I might have ended up consuming multiple cheeseburgers in under a minute, but I can neither confirm nor deny that.  Ok, it might have been 2 minutes.
17.title: Day 3 - Wonderland Trail

18.caption: Ugh.  More wildflowers.
18.text: Seriously, they were everything.  So annoyingly pretty.
18.title: Day 3 - Wonderland Trail

19.caption: Camping on night #3
19.text: Cowboy camping on night #3.  This was at the White River Campground.  It's also a car-camping spot, which meant I had to walk around and drool at the huge spreads of food that people had.  I have a lot of sympathy for bears, even I could smell the burgers from a mile away :(
19.title: Day 3 - Wonderland Trail

20.caption: A shelter.  Looks like the AT!
20.text: They only have a few shelters on the Wonderland Trail this is one of them.  And no, I didn't stay in it.
20.title: Day 4 - Wonderland Trail

21.caption: Summerland
21.text: The entrance to Summerland, by far the most spectacular portion of the trail.
21.title: Day 4 - Wonderland Trail

22.caption: Summerland Snow
22.text: Summerland!  Ironically, Summerland was, and usually is, covered with snow.  Luckily, you can just follow the muddy boot tracks, no navigational skills were required for this one.  At least for me, not everyone get perfect weather when they hike this trail.  Sucks to be them, I guess.
22.title: Day 4 - Wonderland Trail

23.caption: A pass, I'm sure it had a name.  No idea what it is.
23.text: From the top of the pass.  Gorgeous!!
23.title: Day 4 - Wonderland Trail

24.text: I'm not sure how my hiking pole got in the way, but it seems to suit me.
24.title: Day 4 - Wonderland Trail

25.caption: The other side of the pass
25.text: Still lots/some snow on the other side of the pass.  Depends on your point-of-view, I guess.
25.title: Day 4 - Wonderland Trail

27.caption: The only bear I saw
27.text: This was the only bear I saw on this trip.  Up close, he just looked like a mangy dog.  He was just a little guy, but he still probably could have killed me with one swipe, if he wanted to.
27.title: Day 4 - Wonderland Trail

28.text: This is one of my favorites
28.title: Day 4 - Wonderland Trail

29.caption: Mt. Adams
29.text: If you look really closely in the background you can see Mt. Adams.  It looked more impressive in person, it's hard to get those distance, hazy mountains to show up in pictures.
29.title: Day 4 - Wonderland Trail

30.caption: Sunset on Rainier
30.text: This image is courtesy of the National Park System, who forced me to hike to a campsite that was 1.5 miles off of the trail on Snow Lake.  Yes, I was extrememly annoying by that, yet it gave me one of the prettiest photos of the entire trip.  Still.  1.5 extra miles.  One way!  That's THREE extra miles total.  Who has the time/energy for that?!?  Ok, I'm over it, I guess it was worth it for this amazing picture...
30.title: Day 4 - Wonderland Trail

31.caption: My typical camping style
31.text: My camp by the now infamous Snow Lake.  I was too annoying at having to hike all the way to Snow Lake to take a picture.  Somehow you'll survive.
31.title: Day 4 - Wonderland Trail

32.caption: Rainier
32.text: This was my last view of Rainier.  Reflection Lakes.
32.title: Day 5 - Wonderland Trail

33.caption: One last selfie
33.text: That's it!  It was a great trip and I really enjoyed the hike, but it was over and done really quickly.  It only took me 5 days to hike the trail: Started at Longmire, then Golden Lakes, Mystic, White River, Snow Lake, and back to Longmire.
33.title: Day 5 - Wonderland Trail

34.caption: Rachel and Ty
34.text: Rachel and Ty, a few days after I got back from the Wonderland Trail.  I assume this was someone's birthday?  I don't remember, but seeing this picture makes me smile.  I miss this house... and Seattle... and Rachel and Ty :(
34.title: Extra 1
